definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Ervatamia divaricata leaf blight is one of the most important diseases in the garden of Jiangxi Agricultural University.
sentences.chinese: 狗牙花葉枯病是江西農業大學花圃重要病害之一。

sentences.english: Many gardeners grow curly parsley as a border for flowerbeds.
sentences.chinese: 很多花園種植皺葉歐芹用來做花圃的邊界。

sentences.english: Kids in the garden playing games.
He tends the flower beds and evergreens that he has planted in the driveway.
sentences.chinese: 他總是細心呵護着種植在車道邊的花圃和常青樹。

sentences.english: The area around the lake is covered with lawns and flowerbeds.
sentences.chinese: 湖的四周，都是草坪和花圃。

sentences.english: At last she believed that the tulip bed was under the protection of the fairies.
sentences.chinese: 她終於相信，鬱金香花圃是受了仙女的保護。

sentences.english: Near a flower garden,two white-haired grannies are knittinging the sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 在一個花圃邊有兩個白頭髮的老太太在織毛衣。

sentences.english: The flowerbeds and trees make our school beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 花圃和樹木使學校很美麗。

sentences.english: bluebird in the garden, a spirit in a house, a kind man on the side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 花圃中的藍知更鳥，衡宇中的精靈，路邊的大好人。

sentences.english: There is summer house inside, swimming-pool, garden, gymnastical equipment.
sentences.chinese: 內有涼亭，泅水池，花圃，健身器材。

sentences.english: Near a flower garden, two white-haired grannies are knitting in the sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 在一處花圃旁，兩位白髮老太太在陽光下織毛衣。

sentences.english: The swimming pool is between the garden and the flowerbed.
sentences.chinese: 游泳池在花園和花圃之間。

sentences.english: Down in the Pettey Garden we're roving.
Tianlong to do garden party to celebrate the Qing ling.
sentences.chinese: 天朗到花圃辦派對爲清岺慶祝。

sentences.english: Orioles love flowers, love the motherland.
Galvez:As you both know, the United States views Central America as its backyard.
sentences.chinese: 正如你所知，美國將中美洲視爲他的後花圃。

definition: Huatan township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
decorative mass planting of flowers and shrubs, often bounded by a low masonry border, and often part of a streetscape
